Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control allows a text string to be used as a control on a Web page.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LiteralDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LiteralDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when there is a design-time change to the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LiteralDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal> control is raised. Typically, this is in response to a property change on the control (for example, a `Properties` grid change).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LiteralDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs> object and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> base method.
